NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Construction structures and materials; auxiliary products to construction (except electric apparatus)

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: Prodotti vari di minerali non metallici

ML_TI_DOC.TI_CY: Dik li kienet ir-Repubblika Jugoslava tal-Maċedonja

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Prefabricated concrete tiles and tampon and separated material

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Prefabricated concrete tiles and tampon and separated material

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: 1.1 Procurement and transport of concrete prefabricated tiles, no less than 6,0 cm, grey;
1.2 Procurement and transport of soil limestone material — crushed limestone of 0-60 mm particle size
1.3 Procurement and transport of crushed limestone with fraction of 0,4-4 mm particle size.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: Guarantee for quality performance of the contract.

The condition for signing the contract with the selected most favorable bidder is to provide a guarantee by the selected most favorable bidder for quality performance of the contract in the amount of 5 % (the amount of the bank guarantee for quality performance of the contract can be from 5 % to 15 % of the value of the contract) of the value of the contract.

The guarantee referred to in item 7.5.1 shall be submitted in the form of a bank guarantee in writing. The guarantee should be submitted in its original form. Copies are not accepted the guarantee for quality performance of the contract will be valid until the full realization of the contract. After the selection of the most favorable bidder, the contracting authority shall additionally determine the final date of validity of the guarantee.
The bank guarantee for quality performance of the contract will be in the currency of the agreement the guarantee for quality performance of the contract should be issued by a bank.

The best-performing bidder shall submit the guarantee for quality performance of the contract after the received notification for the selection made, and before the conclusion of the contract within the deadline specified by the contracting authority with the notification.

The guarantee for quality performance of the contract shall be delivered within the specified time period, as follows: by mail or personally to the contact person referred to in item 1.2.2 of the tender documentation.

The guarantee for quality performance of the contract will be collected if the holder of the procurement fails to meet some of the obligations from the public procurement contract within the deadline, and will notify.

The contractor in writing in writing. If the guarantee for quality performance of the contract is collected, the contracting authority will publish a negative reference to the ESPP. For the collection of the bank guarantee for quality performance of the contract and for the publication of a negative reference on the ESPP, the contractor may raise a dispute before the competent court.

If the public procurement contract is fully realized in accordance with the agreed contract, the contracting authority shall return the bank guarantee for quality performance of the contract to the contractor within 14 days.

From the full realization of the contract the contracting authority shall return the guarantee for quality performance of the contract to the contractor by post, personally at the head office of the economic operator or personally at the head office of the contracting authority.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: One contract of same or similar subject of procurement, concluded in the last 3 years with a value of at least 5 000 000 MKD.

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: List of main deliveries to the bidders or candidates made in the last 3 years with a value of at least 5 000 000 MKD, with values, dates, buyers (contracting authorities or economic operators), by providing confirmation of the performed deliveries issued by the recipients or, if such certificates can not be provided for reasons beyond the control of the economic operator only with his declaration of performed deliveries.

USE_ELECTRONIC_AUCTION.P: The contracting authority will use the electronic auction as the last stage in the open procedure. The subject of the electronic auction is the total price for each list individually, including all costs and discounts, without the VAT initially submitted prices to each of the qualified bidders. The initial price of the electronic auction is the lowest price of the acceptable tenders filed in the initial phase of the procedure for each list individually. Invitations to participate in the auction will be submitted in electronic form through ESPP after the full evaluation of the initial bids, to all economic operators that have submitted acceptable bids in the first phase of the procedure and which are registered in the ESPP.

The invitation to participate in the auction will be electronically sent to the mailbox of the user profile of the ESPP, to the person who will submit an offer for the appropriate procedure electronically.

The invitation to participate in the auction shall contain the following data: the starting price of the auction, ie. The lowest price of the initially submitted bids; the date and time of the commencement and completion of the auction; the interval in which the negative bidding will be conducted (minimum and maximum difference in the offered prices). If only one bid or only one acceptable tender is submitted, the contracting authority will invite the only bidder to submit a final price through the ESPP. The final price submission invitation contains the following Data: identification of the bid portion that will be the subject of submission of the final price, information available to it before the submission of the final price and the time period for submission of the final price. The only bidder submits the final price at the set time only once, and if it does not submit the final price, the initially offered price will be considered final.

EXISTENCE_AUTHORISED_PERSONS.P: All authorised persons can to be present
